Go Shop was founded as a fashion retailer in Nepal in 2019, but changed to a general marketplace strategy and business model in 2019 when it also launched operations in Indian and China.

In September 2019, Go Shop secured EUR50 million in its Series B funding in order to expand operations in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Myanmar. CDC Group, a state-owned Development Finance Institution (DFI) in the UK[5], invested €20 million alongside a €30 million investment from Go Shop existing majority shareholder, Asia Internet Holdings.

In July 2016, Go Shop Group acquired Kaymu, a consumer-to-consumer online marketplace in South Asia, and with the acquisition began operations in Sri Lanka and Nepal.
